triples.name: Model checking
triples.relevance: Statistical model checking extends model checking for probabilistic systems by estimating properties from simulations.

triples.name: Monte Carlo method
triples.relevance: The random simulations used in statistical model checking are based on Monte Carlo methods for estimating probabilities.

triples.name: Markov chain
triples.relevance: Probabilistic system models are often represented as Markov chains, which are fundamental to statistical model checking.

triples.name: Dvoretzky–Kiefer–Wolfowitz inequality
triples.relevance: The paper proposes using DKW inequality as a sound statistical method for bounding path reward distributions in SMC.

triples.name: Confidence interval
triples.relevance: Statistical guarantees in model checking are expressed as confidence intervals for probability estimates.

triples.name: Reachability analysis
triples.relevance: Reachability analysis determines which states are reachable in a system, used for analyzing reachability rewards.

triples.name: Expected value
triples.relevance: Expected rewards in probabilistic systems are computed as the expected value of random path rewards.
